questions.query: Communications is

options.text: 75% verbal and 25% non-verbal
the exchange of information between individuals
is greatly improved by sitting side-by-side
has no cultural element in it

questions.query: Most fatal accidents in aviation occur during the:

options.text: Take-off phase
Cruise phase
Landing phase
Descent phase

questions.query: How is the rate and depth of breathing controlled?

options.text: By the amount of white blood cells (leukocytes) in the blood
By the amount of red blood cells (RBC) in the blood
By the amount of CO (Carbon Monoxide) and O2 in the blood
By the amount of CO2 (Carbon Dioxide) in the blood

questions.query: What is the function of white blood cells within blood?

options.text: to transport oxygen
to coagulate the blood
to counter infections
to repair blood vessels after an injury

questions.query: Which of the following can be a cause of anaemic hypoxia?

options.text: Smoking
Fatigue
Decompression
High altitude

questions.query: Monocular cues are used in order to judge depth and distances at long range. Which of the following is NOT a monocular cue:

options.text: colour distinction, which may be hindered by fog
Texture cues, which may be hindered by fog
Convergence of line features suggesting depth
Minute differences detected in the two retinal images of an object

questions.query: A pilot could fly a lower than normal (undershoot) visual approach due to certain circumstances:

options.text: An approach to a runway with an unexpected up slope
An approach to a runway with an unexpected down slope
An approach to an unexpectedly wide runway
An approach with reduced visibility

questions.query: "Complacency" means:

options.text: a general lack of critical analysis of the circumstances
the perfect execution of the crew concept
hypervigilence
the loss of Manual Flying Skills

questions.query: An autocratic leadership is described by:

options.text: Despite the strong authority of the captain, everything functions correctly owing to his natural leadership
The captain's authoritarian leadership style makes him to overvalue his own judgement and to undervalue the judgements of his crewmembers
The captain's authoritarian leadership style makes him receptive to inputs from his first officer
The atmosphere is relaxed thanks to a captain who leaves complete freedom to the various members of the crew

questions.query: What is selective attention?

options.text: Ability to focus attention on several activities at one time
Ability to focus attention on one source at a time
An increased distration by irrelevant cues
It is generated after too much amount of stress

questions.query: What is a typical example of an undesired aircraft state to the TEM concept?

options.text: Any action by the flight crew in order to correct a flight crew error
Any action by the flight crew to prevent an organisational threat
Flying too fast during approach
first the error should be adressed before correcting the undersired aircraft state

questions.query: The Nervous System can be devided into two parts. How are those called?

options.text: The somatic Nervous System and the Autonomic Nervous System
Advanced System and Sympathetic System
Sensory System and Motor System
Central Nervous System and Peripheral Nervous System

questions.query: What are the five factors of “The Big Five” personality traits?

options.text: Unsympathetic, depressed, egocentric, sensation seeking and dominancy
Neuroticism, Safety needs, belonging, self-esteem, self-fullfilment
Anti-Authority, impulsiveness, invulnerability, macho and resignation
Conscientiousness, agreeableness, neuroticism, openess to experience and extroversion

questions.query: Name the main types of long term memories and their tasks.

options.text: Semantic memory for recalling fact and figures and Procedural memory for recalling specific events
Episodic memory for recalling facts and figures and Semantic memory for recalling specific events.
Episodic memory for recalling facts and figures, photografic memory for recalling pictures and Episodic memory for recalling specific events.
Episodic memory for recalling specific events, Semantic memory for recalling facts and figures and Procedural memory for motor programmes

questions.query: When sound waves are detected by the eardrum, these signals go

options.text: via the middle ear to the Cochlea
via the middle ear to the Vestibular System
directly to the Auditory nerve
directly to the Cortex

questions.query: What are main causes of deafness?

options.text: Conductive Deafness and Tinitus
Presbycusis and Tinitis
Sensori-neural deafness, Noise Induced Hearing Loss
Noise Induced Hearing Loss and Conductive Deafness

questions.query: How is linear acceleration detected?

options.text: By movement of the hair-like otoliths in the ultricle and /or saccule
By movement of the hairs  in the semi-circular canals
By the joint reactions of the semi-circular canals and the otoliths
By movement of the fluid in the Cochlea

questions.query: What part of the eye controls the amount of light entering the eye?

options.text: The Iris
The Eyelids
The Lens
The Pupil

questions.query: Which of the following statement is correct?

options.text: The leans is a visual illusion
Coriolis is a visual illusion
Black Hole Effect is a visual illusion
Air Sickness is a vestibular illusion

questions.query: Which diseases are spread by contaminated water?

options.text: Typhoid Fever, Cholera and Hepatitis
Ecoli, Malaria, Thypoid and Dengue
Tuberculosis, Cholera and Typhoid Fever
Typhoid Fever, Malaria, Yellow Fever

questions.query: Why should a pilot not fly when he/she has a heavy cold?

options.text: In flight the pressure in the middle ear has to be the same as the inner ear. A blocked eustachian tube may prevent this to happen
In flight the pressure on either side of the eardrum has to be the same. With a blocked eustacian tube during climb, the lower pressure cannot escape
AIt may lead to an Otic Barotrauma
With a blocked eustachian tube, the pilot will not be able to equalise the pressure of the inner ear.

questions.query: What is REM-sleep?

options.text: REM-sleep is Rapid Eye Movement and is the dream stage of each sleep cycle
REM-sleep is the earliest stage in each sleep cycle
REM-sleep is the lastsecond stage in each sleep cycle
REM-sleep is the third stage in each sleep cycle

questions.query:
East-west flights crossing several time zones can result in significant circadian dysrhythmia. Eastbound routes haing a greater negative effect the wastbound.

The reason for this effect is:

options.text: Eastbound Flights loose more time than westbound flights gain
Westbound Flights are hindered by the (average) 25 hours circadian clock, and eastbound flights are aided
Westbound Flights gain more time than eastbound flight loose
Westbound Flights are aided by the (average) 25 hours circadian clock and eastbound flights are worsened

questions.query: What is the Time of Usefull Consciousness (TUC) for a seated person at rest at 40.000 ft during a decompression?

options.text: 15-20 seconds
1 - 2 minutes
9 - 12 seconds
5 seconds

questions.query: In the SHELL model, which of the answers below is an example of problematic Liveware-Hardware Interaction?

options.text: A poorly indexed operating manual
Switches, controls and/or displays with poor design
Noise interference
Misunderstanding ATC

questions.query: What is an indicator of good Situational AWareness?

options.text: feeling that events are in control of you
The pilot follows SOP's correctly
Building a correct mental picture of one's situation
The pilot manages time efficiently when carrying out tasks

questions.query: A human error associated with automation is:

options.text: a reduced monitoring task
checklist interruptions
hypervigilance
loss of mode awareness

questions.query: An example of a potential conflict between status and role is

options.text: an ATC controller interviewing an inexperienced captain
a senior captain acting as co-pilot to a junior captain of an aircraft
a security officer temporarily standing in for a member of the cabin crew
The role of flight-examiner is performed by an experienced captain

questions.query: The purpose of the multi-crew concept is:

options.text: Generation of a social environment
redundancy and  a division of responsability and workload sharing
Discussions with crew members so that correct decisions can be made
Pilots have to know how to operate the aircraft in order to fly it safely

questions.query: Stress is

options.text: a psychosomatic disease that one can learn to control
a heightened state of arousal caused by external, stressful events
a phenomenon whch is specific to modern mankind
always bad

questions.query: At night while flying VFR and “wings level”, you notice the artificial horizon indicates 20’ right bank

options.text: As you are convinced you fly horizontally, your artificial horizon must be wrong
You may be suffering a visual illusion and the horzon is most probably correct
Switch on your landinglights to verify you are in level flight
Bend your head to the lower side of the artificial horizon in order to compensate for your somatografic illusion

questions.query: Hypovigilance may be counteracted by

options.text: performing small mental calculations to keep yourself alert
drinking coffee
frequent yawning
Reducing the intensity of the lights

questions.query: What are the two different types of illusions?

options.text: Proprioception illusions and Deep sleep illusions
Vestibular illusions and Visual illusions
Jetlag illusions and Visual illusions
Vestibular illusions and Blind Spot illusions

questions.query: Regardless of the cause of the stress, the body's initial physiological response is always the same. The purpose if the Alarm phase of this so-called General Adaptation Syndrome is

options.text: to attempt to repair the damage caused by the stressor
to attemp to maintain the body's arousal state to the continuing stress
to prepare the body for "fight or flight"
to recognise the danger and to slow the body down via the autonomic system

questions.query: ICAO pilot competencies are

options.text: WLM, SAW and PSD
FPA, FPC and APK
SAW, COM and SHELL
TEM, LTW and APK

questions.query: The SHELL model consistes of

options.text: Self, Hardware, Environment, Lifeware, Labor
Software, Human, Environment, Lifeware, Litigation
Software, Hardware, Environment, Lifeware and Lifware (peripheral)
Self, Human, Environment, Lethargy, Lifeware

questions.query: The Swiss Cheese Model is

options.text: is a model describing human behaviour
is a model describing cockpit management and automation
a model describing that a combintion of latent and active failures may lead to a fatal accident
a model for mitigating errors

questions.query: A just culture

options.text: is limitted to the flight department of an CAT-operator only
can punish deliberate violations and acts of gross negligence
is a negative safety culture
is non-punitive

questions.query: The purpose of SMS, or Safety Management System is

options.text: to have a Zero Defect Programma
improve Flight Deck Ergonomics
Provide an effective reporting system across the organisation so that risks and countermeasures are developted and known to all
is about having "Safety First" at all costs.

questions.query: Within the altitudes at which CAT-aircraft operate, the proportion of gases by volume remains the same. For oxygen this is about 20%

options.text: False
True

questions.query: A Pilot's medical licence may be disqualified by

options.text: hypertention only
hypotention only
hypertension and by hypotension
neither of these two

questions.query: Factors affecting the pulse rate are

options.text: body weight, pain
altitude, body weight
age, altitude,
body temperature, physical exercise

questions.query: What is true about Hypoxia?

options.text: A sudden decompression may lead to Hypoxic Hypoxia
A sudden decompression will lead to Anaemic Hypoxia
Smoking may lead to Hypoxic Hypoxia
Below FL250 Hypoxic Hypoxia is not a problem for healthy people

questions.query: The TUC at FL400 for a seated person is approximately

options.text: 30 min
1-2 min

questions.query: According EASA, due to the risk of decompression sickness, Flight crew after SCUBA diving, should not resume flying duties within

options.text: 12 hours of diving
24 hours of diving
36 hours of diving
48 hours of diving

questions.query: Hyperventilation may lead to

options.text: diabetes
obesity
fainting
euphoria

questions.query: Loss of situational awareness can be caused by

options.text: sensory inputs below the sensory threshold
sensory inputs above the sensory threshold
a stimilus below the response
a response below the stimilus

questions.query: Automatically darkening sunglasses and polarised sunglasses are not permitted to be used by flight crew

options.text: true
false
only polarised sunglasses re not permitted
only photochromatic (automatic darkening) sunglasses are not permitted

questions.query: Regarding angular and linear acceleration

options.text: linear acceleration is experienced when an aircraft climbs or descends
linear acceleration will lead to progressive loss of vision (black-out)
angular acceleration may lead to progressive loss of vision (black-out)
Angular acceleration is experienced when an aircraft climbs or descends

questions.query: The mental modelling humans use for quickly interpreting a visual scene has great benefits but also holds great dangers. Visual constancy (in colour, size and shape) may easily fool our brain

options.text: as it may appear to the human brain  to have different colour, shape or size, but there is none
into increased vigilance
as it may induce dizziness and vertigo
into Motion sickness

questions.query: Radiation is a high altitude hazard and is greatest at the

options.text: Poles
Mid- lattitudes
Equator
Southern Hemisphere

questions.query: Insect born diseases are

options.text: cholera, hepatitis, dengue
malaria, thyphoid, tuberculosis
dengue, malaria, yellow fever
Parasites, malaria, tuberculosis

questions.query: In general the REM sleep takes about 20 minutes and takes place about 1 to 2 hours after starting a sleep cycle.

options.text: The REM sleep is where the sleep walking may take place
The REM sleep is where the dreaming takes place
The REM sleep is stage 4 of the 5 stage sleep cycle
frequent REM sleep deprivation is not harmfull

questions.query: When in sudden darkness, your instant nightvision is best

options.text: by focussing and using your cones
by using your peripheral vison based on your rods by moving your head
by using your fovea
by using your blind spot

questions.query: The vasalva manoeuvre might help to prevent

options.text: dental barotrauma
fainting
otic barotrauma
gastro-intestal barotrauma

questions.query: Followership is

options.text: the ability to withold your opinion
the ability to perform all duties diligently
the skill of complementing leadership
the ability to absorb unpleasant comments and barked orders
